result.execSummary:
The defendant Kendra KL Williams was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

miscConds.notes: Attend the following programs and/or assessments:  AODA and Mental Health and any treatment deemed appropriate.
No contact with MRB or the family.
Obtain High School diploma or GED/HSED. Participate in vocational/educational programming. Obtain/maintain employment if not in school.

Court ordered defendant to provide a DNA sample and pay DNA analysis surcharge. Pay supervision fees as determined by the Wisconsin Department of Corrections. Pay all costs, fees and assessments, any cash bail to apply.  Failure to pay shall result in a civil judgment.

timeConds.notes: This time is stayed. To be used by the agent for any sanctions or probation violations.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kendra KL Williams

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Kendra KL Williams in court with attorney Stephen A Sargent.  Defendant Kendra KL Williams in custody.  Miriam S Falk appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements made by counsel, the defendant and the Court.  Court sentenced defendant to serve 6 MONTHS in the House of Correction consecutive to any other sentence; credit for 0 days served.  Court STAYED sentence and placed defendant on PROBATION for 12 MONTHS with the following conditions:
- As a condition of probation, the Court ordered the defendant to serve 6 MONTHS in the House of Correction.  This time is stayed to be used by the agent for any sanctions or probation violations.
- Attend the following programs and/or assessments:  AODA and Mental Health and any treatment deemed appropriate.
- No contact with MRB or the family.
- Obtain High School diploma or GED/HSED.
- Participate in vocational/educational programming.
- Obtain/maintain employment if not in school.
-  Perform 50 hours of community service.
-  Participate in Parenting classes.
- Court ordered defendant to provide a DNA sample and pay DNA analysis surcharge.
- Pay supervision fees as determined by the Wisconsin Department of Corrections.
- Pay all costs, fees and assessments, any cash bail to apply.  Failure to pay shall result in a civil judgment.
- Court advised defendant of his right to seek postconviction relief.  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed.

Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if she is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.
Case adjourned to 6-6-2014 at 8:30 a.m. for sentencing hearing in Branch 10.

Defendant Kendra KL Williams in court with attorney Stephen A Sargent.  Defendant Kendra KL Williams in custody.  Sara B Lewis appeared for the State of Wisconsin for Miriam Falk.
On motion of the State, Court ordered charge amended to Battery, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 940.19(1), a Class A Misdemeanor.

Attorney Stephen A Sargent in court, defendant Kendra KL Williams not in court, in custody.  Miriam S Falk appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
ADA Falk in trial in another court.  Case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 10.    Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed.  Plea hearing scheduled for May 13, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent in court, defendant Kendra KL Williams not in court, in custody.  Miriam S. Falk appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 10.  Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed.  Plea hearing scheduled for May 5, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Court orders other terms and conditions of bail to remain the same.
Bail motion by defense argued and granted by the Court.  Bail AMENDED TO $250 CASH.

Defendant Kendra KL Williams in court with attorney Louis Epps for Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant Kendra KL Williams in custody.  Thomas Potter for Miriam S. Falk appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.   Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dugan, Branch 10.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 4, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.

  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with M.R.B., her family or residence.

Defendant Kendra KL Williams in court with attorney Danielle L. Shelton.  Defendant Kendra KL Williams in custody.  Joanne L. Hardtke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dugan, Branch 10.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings. 
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 27, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
